name: De-ashi-barai
description: A technique where you sweep the opponent’s foot as they step forward.

name: Hane-goshi
description: A technique where you lift the opponent with your hip and throw them over.

name: Hane-goshi-gaeshi
description: A counter technique to Hane-goshi, where you reverse the throw.

name: Harai-goshi
description: A sweeping throw where you use your hip to sweep the opponent’s legs from under them.

name: Harai-makikomi
description: A technique where the attacker sweeps the opponent’s leg while wrapping them for a throw.

name: Hiza-guruma
description: A technique where you block the opponent’s knee and turn them over the block.

name: Kata-guruma
description: A technique where you lift the opponent onto your shoulders and throw them.

name: Koshi-guruma
description: A hip throw where you pull the opponent around your hip to throw them.

name: Kosoto-gake
description: A technique where you hook the opponent’s outside foot to throw them.

name: Kosoto-gari
description: A technique where you sweep the opponent’s outside foot to unbalance them.

name: Kouchi-gari
description: A technique where you sweep the opponent’s inside leg.

name: Morote-gari
description: A technique where the attacker uses both hands to grab the opponent’s legs and sweep them.

name: Obitori-gaeshi
description: A counter technique to a belt grab, where the attacker reverses the throw.

name: Osoto-gaeshi
description: A counter technique to Osoto-gari, where you reverse the opponent's throw.

name: Osoto-gari
description: A technique where you reap the opponent’s leg to throw them down.

name: Osoto-guruma
description: A technique similar to Osoto-gari, but with a sweeping wheel-like motion.

name: Osoto-makikomi
description: A variation of Osoto-gari where the attacker uses a wrapping motion to throw the opponent.

name: Osoto-otoshi
description: A variation of Osoto-gari where the throw is executed by dropping the opponent.

name: Ouchi-gari
description: A technique where you reap the opponent’s inside leg to unbalance them.

name: Sasae-tsuri-komi-ashi
description: A technique where you block the opponent’s ankle and turn them over the block.

name: Soto-makikomi
description: A technique where the attacker wraps around the opponent to throw them.

name: Sumi-gaeshi
description: A sacrifice throw where you drop backward and throw the opponent over your shoulder.

name: Sumi-otoshi
description: A technique where the attacker drops the opponent to a corner using a sweeping motion.

name: Tai-otoshi
description: A technique where you block the opponent’s leg and pull them over to throw them.

name: Tani-otoshi
description: A technique where you pull the opponent backwards while dropping to the mat.

name: Tomoe-nage
description: A sacrifice throw where you fall backwards and throw the opponent using a circular motion.

name: Tsuri-goshi
description: A hip throw where you lift the opponent by the belt and throw them.

name: Tsuri-goshi-gaeshi
description: A counter technique to Tsuri-goshi, where you reverse the throw.

name: Uchi-mata
description: A technique where you lift the opponent by the inner thigh and throw them down.

name: Uchi-mata-gaeshi
description: A counter technique to Uchi-mata, where you reverse the throw.

name: Uchimata-sukashi
description: A technique where the attacker steps around an Uchi-mata attempt to counter-throw.

name: Uki-goshi
description: A hip throw where you pull the opponent slightly upward as you throw them.

name: Ura-nage
description: A technique where you lift the opponent from behind and throw them backward.

name: Ushiro-goshi
description: A technique where you lift the opponent by the waist and throw them backward.

name: Ushiro-otoshi
description: A technique where the attacker pulls the opponent backwards to throw them.

name: Yoko-gake
description: A sacrifice throw where you use a hooking action to throw the opponent.

name: Yoko-guruma
description: A sacrifice throw where you turn sideways to throw the opponent.

name: Yoko-otoshi
description: A technique where you drop to the side and throw the opponent using a sideways motion.

name: Yoko-tomoe-nage
description: A side variation of Tomoe-nage, where you throw the opponent using a sideways motion.

name: Yoko-wakare
description: A sacrifice throw where the attacker falls to the side, separating from the opponent.
